reference: Volume Five, Issue Forty-Six, File 13 of 28
title: The Phrack University Dialup List
historical_context: This article is part of a series that compiles dial-up numbers for educational institutions, reflecting the early days of internet access and the importance of dial-up connections for students.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, students, and anyone interested in historical internet access methods.
short_summary: The article provides a comprehensive list of dial-up phone numbers for various universities across the United States and Canada, aimed at assisting students in accessing educational resources.
summary: In this article, the authors compile an extensive list of dial-up numbers for universities, primarily in the United States and Canada. The list serves as a resource for students who may need to connect to their university's network via dial-up, a common method of internet access during the time of publication. The article emphasizes the importance of these connections for students, particularly in the context of the early internet era when such access was crucial for academic success. Readers are encouraged to contribute additional numbers to expand the list further, highlighting the collaborative spirit of the hacker and phreaker communities. Overall, this article is a fascinating glimpse into the historical methods of accessing educational resources online.
